content.description:
Climb past 5 bolts through two bulges to the anchors. The lower bulge is techy, and the upper bulge is burly with good rest in between. The bolt hangers are in need of upgrade.

The rating on this one in both the Sharp End guide and Bob's new guide seems way off.  They give 11c, this route felt more 11a-ish.  (Also, the description for this route in the Sharp End book seems to describe

Scarf and Barf

better.)

Regardless of rating, the moves are fun!
content.location:
It is between

Metamusso

and

Scarf and Barf

.

content.description: The easiest route on this section of cliff, Stomach Stapler is immediately left of Binge and Purge.  A short outing up easy rock to a bulge.  A few more quality moves gets you to the anchors.

Start at the tree on the ledge, just right of center on the

Dave's  Dangle

wall. A few interesting moves get you to a horizontal with good holds. Get a shake here and bust through the crux bulge on sequential & somewhat sharp pockets.
content.location:
This is immediately right of

Team Anorexia

.

content.description:
Located a few hundred yards to the left of the Surreal Estate Wall, immediately left of

Dave Dangle

(5.11b/c). This steep route features a stout boulder problem. If you like bouldery routes and shy from enduro routes, this is the line for you. Saddle up, climb through the interesting yet easy start. Make some fun moves through the roof and get ready to tango.

Slight hints, that some might consider BETA follow. Note that the crux clip is a bit tough to clip for short folks, and much easier with a draw in place. In fact the route itself is possibly height dependent in grade, as the crux move (for me) fell to a dynamic move off of bad holds.

This is another short route on the Anorexia Wall.  As with the other routes here, this starts with a brief section of steep slab to a sloping ledge.  Muscle over a short overhanging section and head for the anchors on black rock.
content.location:
The next route right of

Dave Dangle

.

content.description:
This is several hundred feet to the left of Surreal Estate Wall and three routes left of

Binge and Purge

, also just right of the steep roof route

Power Broker

(12c/d). Ascend easy but slightly loose rock to the first bolt. The interesting slab leads to the roof. Tackle the roof quickly, feet dangling for effect, and make the long moves that will take you to the anchor.

Scramble up to a bolt on the right and start trending left towards the midway ledge.  Trust your feet or crank hard over the bulge to gain the upper crack.  Afterwards the occasional stem or jam on steep rock will deposit you at the chain anchors on top.
content.location:
This is the first bolted route to the left of

Power Broker

. Follow sidepulls and flakes to a seam that splits the steeper headwall.

content.description:
On the right hand side of the wall with

Dave Dangle

, several hundred feet to the left of Surreal Estate Wall.  Scramble up to the ledge for belaying this climb.  Climbs quickly out over the bulge and up interesting moves to the anchors.
